original_query.title: detect health-related queries
original_query.description: How can an algorithm detect health-related queries? E.g., so that the search engine ensures that no harmful results are shown.
original_query.narrative: A paper is relevant if it discusses algorithms to detect health-related queries.

query: large language models for query expansion

original_query.title: large language models for query expansion
original_query.description: How can large language models be used for query expansion?
original_query.narrative: A paper is relevant if it discusses LLMs to expand a given user query.

original_query.title: datasets for web search
original_query.description: I look for a benchmark dataset for testing web search engines. what such datasets are available?
original_query.narrative: A paper is relevant if it describes a dataset, potentially a web crawl that can be used to evaluate retrieval algorithms. If the datasets comes with relevance judgments, it is highly relevant.

original_query.title: known item search for movies
original_query.description: I want to support users that want to refind moves. E.g., if a user watched a movie as child, and now wants to find the movie again, but maybe forgot the title.
original_query.narrative: A paper is relevant if it describes approaches for known item search or refinding tasks in the domain of movies.
